text: <@U010AASPU7Q> has joined the channel

Came across an idea from <@U01084LG140> about making grocery delivery available for elderly. Question for locals - if stores had a delivery option, do you think it would be accessible/utilized? Does something similar exist already?

elements.text: Came across an idea from
about making grocery delivery available for elderly. Question for locals - if stores had a delivery option, do you think it would be accessible/utilized? Does something similar exist already?

text: <@U01084LG140> has joined the channel

yeah, have you heard of <https://addismercato.com/en/> ? I'm sure there are other small competitors, but I've seen alot of advertisements for addis mercato. Unsure of how much it's actually used on ground tho

attachments.title: Addis Mercato
attachments.text: Welcome to Ethiopia's first end-to-end online marketplace. We bring the store to you!Try hassle-free shopping for a change! No need to fight traffic or parking. Go ahead and select fresh food items from the best supermarkets and stores in town and experience our top-notch customer service. We encourage you to register and start placing items in your cart so we can deliver them straight to your doorstep! Please refer to the videos below to learn how to Register and Save Your Address in your profile.ግብይትዎን ለማቃለል አዲስ መርካቶ የሚያስፈልግዎትን ሁሉ እቤትዎ ድረስ ያቀርባል። ከኦንላይን ሱቃችን ማንኛውንም ምርት ማዘዝ ከፈለጉ ዛሬውኑ ይመዝገቡና ትዕዛዝዎን ያስገቡ።ከዚህ በታች ባለው ቪዲዮ እንዴት እንደሚመዘገቡ እና አድራሻዎትን እንደሚጠቁሙን ይመልከቱ።Learn how to:1) How to Register and Save Your Addressበዚህ ቪዲዮ እንዴት አድራሻ እንደሚያስቀምጡ እናሳይዎታለን።2) Item Selection and Checkoutቀጥሎም ግብይትና ክፍያ አደራረግ በዚህ ቪድዮ ይመልከቱ።English Version: How to Register and Save Delivery Address on <http://AddisMercato.com|AddisMercato.com>

text: super interesting, thanks for sharing. I'm familiar w/ <https://deliveraddis.com/|Deliver Addis> but not this. Speaking with my cousin who is well connected there tomorrow - will ask him if he can connect us with them or similar resources. Would love to chat with them about how we could help support making this more widely available

attachments.text: Ethiopia's #1 online delivery service featuring some of the best spots in town.

text: Great progress <@U010B7Q6XE0>... If there is a way to make this happen, lets see if we can include medicine and or hand sanitizes as things we could include for the folks that are high risk. I am not certain we will have access to all that yet but clearing up the possibilities with the carriers is a good idea. Keep going.

elements.text: Great progress

... If there is a way to make this happen, lets see if we can include medicine and or hand sanitizes as things we could include for the folks that are high risk. I am not certain we will have access to all that yet but clearing up the possibilities with the carriers is a good idea. Keep going.

text: <@U010B7Q6XE0> Also would be interesting to see if these delivery services offer telephone ordering, or if it is possible to have a person as a middle man that can order for people that do not have access to the necessary internet/device requirements. Just to make it accessible to more people on the ground.

elements.text: Also would be interesting to see if these delivery services offer telephone ordering, or if it is possible to have a person as a middle man that can order for people that do not have access to the necessary internet/device requirements. Just to make it accessible to more people on the ground.

text:
Just received this Yelp like review of a local Grocery Delivery....

For those interested, we just gave this online grocery delivery service a try and were pleased. Delivery man was wearing gloves and respectfully kept his distance, as did we. 
<https://asbeza.net|https://asbeza.net>

elements.text:
Just received this Yelp like review of a local Grocery Delivery....

For those interested, we just gave this online grocery delivery service a try and were pleased. Delivery man was wearing gloves and respectfully kept his distance, as did we.
https://asbeza.net

text: Also a Kebele around CMC is driving around with a megaphone encouraging people to stay home and offering home delivery of the basic items such as oil, sugar, oil, ... from the kebele, especially to elderly people.

elements.text: Also a Kebele around CMC is driving around with a megaphone encouraging people to stay home and offering home delivery of the basic items such as oil, sugar, oil, ... from the kebele, especially to elderly people.

text: <@U01084LG140> Great point - telephone ordering is seems like it would be the most accessible. Will look into this

text: <@U010787AZ2T> thank you for sharing! this is great - will try to get in touch with them to learn more about how they operate/see if we can work together

text: <@U010B7Q6XE0> I just sent an invite to the owner/founder of Asbeza

elements.text: I just sent an invite to the owner/founder of Asbeza

text: Perfect. Just spoke w/ my cousin in Addis and he mentioned <https://zmallshop.com/deliveries/addis-ababa|Zmall> as another grocery delivery option as well. I'm having him join the group because he has some really interesting perspective on current initiatives/what is worth working on. He did mention that many elders already live w/ children/grandchildren who can help w/ picking up necessities. Zmall also has an option for ordering over the phone which helps w/ the idea of supporting those w/ low tech access

elements.text: Perfect. Just spoke w/ my cousin in Addis and he mentioned
Zmall

as another grocery delivery option as well. I'm having him join the group because he has some really interesting perspective on current initiatives/what is worth working on. He did mention that many elders already live w/ children/grandchildren who can help w/ picking up necessities. Zmall also has an option for ordering over the phone which helps w/ the idea of supporting those w/ low tech access

text: He mentioned that these companies like Asbeza/Zmall are small, so getting them to support more people would require getting all of them on board

elements.text: He mentioned that these companies like Asbeza/Zmall are small, so getting them to support more people would require getting all of them on board

text: <@U010FBDN5QQ> thoughts here on the general idea of getting goods delivered w/ support of existing tools like these?

elements.text: thoughts here on the general idea of getting goods delivered w/ support of existing tools like these?

text: <@U010FBDN5QQ> has joined the channel

<@U010B7Q6XE0> All of them are small...Startups...but this is the moment for them to scale.
Asbeza charges 96birr whether you order 1birr or a 1,000birr worth of groceries. The issue will be who will cover the cost of delivery. Maybe this is where the external funding can come into play. 
<@U01087PJBNG>, wanna include this in your 1-pager?

elements.text:
All of them are small...Startups...but this is the moment for them to scale.
Asbeza charges 96birr whether you order 1birr or a 1,000birr worth of groceries. The issue will be who will cover the cost of delivery. Maybe this is where the external funding can come into play.
, wanna include this in your 1-pager?

text: Yes, I agree that the cost of service seems to be the biggest hurdle at the moment. I'm curious if we can support them financially/convince them that reducing costs during this crisis can expand their reach now and is an opportunity to grow their user base and potentially create longer term revenue after the crisis is dealt with. <@U010FBDN5QQ> might have some insights here as he is familiar with building business partnerships in Addis

elements.text: Yes, I agree that the cost of service seems to be the biggest hurdle at the moment. I'm curious if we can support them financially/convince them that reducing costs during this crisis can expand their reach now and is an opportunity to grow their user base and potentially create longer term revenue after the crisis is dealt with.
might have some insights here as he is familiar with building business partnerships in Addis

text: I think the best next steps here are to also get on the phone with people working at these companies to discuss further. It is late there now but I will reach out to them all via email/phone over the weekend to begin the conversation.

elements.text: I think the best next steps here are to also get on the phone with people working at these companies to discuss further. It is late there now but I will reach out to them all via email/phone over the weekend to begin the conversation.

text: In the meantime, please keep adding other delivery tools that you know of here so we can grow the list.

elements.text: In the meantime, please keep adding other delivery tools that you know of here so we can grow the list.

text: <@U010B7Q6XE0> Do you think ride-hailing services such as RIDE and ZayRide would be interested in these kind of initiatives? I believe ZayRide already offers delivery services and are also actively involved in the COVID19 situation. Worth a shot if someone has connections with them.

elements.text: Do you think ride-hailing services such as RIDE and ZayRide would be interested in these kind of initiatives? I believe ZayRide already offers delivery services and are also actively involved in the COVID19 situation. Worth a shot if someone has connections with them.

text: Habtamu (founder) is very active on linkedin. I'd highly suggest just reaching out to him once we finalize the specific ask

text: Yeah, right now I think the ask is to open a line of communication w/ them to learn if they're already doing anything to support Ethiopians at this time and whether they are interested in our support. From there I think we can work collaboratively with them to outline how we can best work together. I don't think we want to push any specific ideas on them quite yet since there are so many unknown variables.

elements.text: Yeah, right now I think the ask is to open a line of communication w/ them to learn if they're already doing anything to support Ethiopians at this time and whether they are interested in our support. From there I think we can work collaboratively with them to outline how we can best work together. I don't think we want to push any specific ideas on them quite yet since there are so many unknown variables.
